content:
I am Nitin Garg, a senior undergraduate in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics at IIT Kanpur. I found myself interested in statistics, and ever since, I have been working to gain experience in the same. I have learned a lot in my projects under Prof. Dootika Vats which helped me gain useful insights into several areas of statistics. I am currently working on analyzing the effect of Increasing Batch Sizes in Covariance estimation.
I have also had experience with several machine learning tasks from both theoretical as well as practical point of views. I’m looking forward to my experience as a Summer analyst at Goldman Sachs.
I tend to waste my time watching movies and tv series, playing video games, and hanging out with friends.
summary: I am Nitin Garg, a senior undergraduate in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics at IIT Kanpur. I found myself interested in statistics, and ever since, I have been working to gain experience in the same.

content: The tidymodels framework is a collection of R packages for modeling and machine learning using tidyverse principles. This website was built with Hugo, using a theme I developed and maintain. I worked with my former intern, Desirée De Leon, to design the style of the website.
summary: Focussed on improving a chatbot particularly for mental health
title: Conversational Agent for Mental Health

content:
This two-day workshop is designed for those who want to take their R Markdown skills to the next level. We’ll talk about many low-level details in the rmarkdown package and the whole R Markdown ecosystem. The two goals of this workshop are: 1) learn how to fully customize R Markdown output (HTML, LaTeX/PDF, Word, and PowerPoint); and 2) learn more about existing R Markdown extensions in the ecosystem, such as flexdashboard, bookdown, blogdown, pkgdown, xaringan, rticles, and learnr. We will also talk about how to use or develop new language engines (languages that are not R), how to develop HTML widgets, and integrate Shiny with R Markdown.
See the workshop website for more, and links to individual slides below.
summary: Comparing the performance of Variational Inference and MCMC on a dataset
title: Variational Inference vs MCMC
